Question
========
A researcher wants to see if there are differences between male and female psychotherapists in the workload they experience (scale score from 0 = "extremely low workload" to 20 = "extremely high workload"). To make a fair comparison between male and female psychotherapists, the researcher wants to take into account the employment of the psychotherapists. For the variable employment, the researcher distinguishes between part-time and full-time psychotherapists.

Which analysis technique is most appropriate for answering the above question?

Answerlist
----------
* ANOVA
* ANCOVA
* MANOVA
* MANCOVA


Solution
========
Dependent variable: Work pressure Measurement level: continuous Independent variables: gender and tenure Measurement level: categorical With a continuous dependent variable and two categorical independent variables, an ANOVA is the most appropriate analysis technique. It is then a two-way ANOVA.
